body:
Part of admission webhook GA tasks 

Would have caught https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/76107 and https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/75193

Setup: 
* Use `framework.StartTestServer` (or something similar) to start a test API server with mutating and validating webhook admission plugins enabled
* Start a recording webhook listener in process (using http.NewTestServer or something similar) that decodes and records mutating and validating admission requests, along with the GroupVersionKind and GroupVersionResource of the object and oldObject sent

Test:
* Use the discovery client to find all registered API groups, versions, resources, subresources, and writeable verbs (create, update, patch, delete, deletecollection, connect)
* For every combination (with the exception of explicit whitelists), make a corresponding API request and ensure that both the validating and mutating webhooks are called, with the expected GVK and GVR for the old and new object.

Tips:
* The fixtures exposed by the existing etcd integration test could be a good foundation (they can all be created, you can construct a generic update by setting a label, and delete needs no fixture).
* Subresources and CONNECT operations will need special handling. Some (like pods/exec or pods/proxy) require API objects to be in specific states, etc. We don't actually care about the operation succeeding (we won't have a backing pod or proxy endpoint), just that admission is called correctly. My suggestion would be to have a map[struct{gvr,subresource,verb}]testFunc to ensure we have covering tests for every case, stub out the test functions for now, and gradually implement them in follow ups.
* There will be a whitelist of things we do not expect admission to get called for (examples are the admission config objects themselves)
* There will also be a temporary list of known failures where admission is not called (but should be) or is attempted to be called, and errors. It is fine to have a list of known failure cases that get skipped so we can get the first iteration of the test in, and gradually prune that list of known failures down as we fix the issues.

/cc @sbezverk 
/area test
/sig api-machinery

title: Add integration testing for admission webhooks
